SENT.plain: Granule-laden perivascular cells distributed around the fine vessels in brain of hypertensive rabbits fed a cholesterol diet were examined by electron microscopy
Perivenule granule-laden cells contained secondary lysosomes, residual bodies, Golgi vesicles, fusion vesicles, and vacuoles
In periarteriole granule-laden cells, secondary lysosomes and vacuoles were not prominent
Findings indicated that the granule-laden cell may be a histiocyte that appears during the vascular reaction to hypertension and hypercholesterolemia
This vascular reaction may occur more strongly in the veins than the arteries
